XIII.i.4.C.1.f
.
Conditions SC Only for Dental Treatment Purposes
Per
38 CFR 3.381(b)
, the following conditions may not be considered compensable dental disabilities.  They may be SC non-compensable dental conditions solely for the purpose of determining entitlement to Class II or Class II(a) dental treatment under
38 CFR 17.161
.
treatable carious teeth
chronic periodontal disease (pyorrhea)
replaceable missing teeth, and
dental or alveolar abscesses.
Note
:  This list is not exclusive and other dental conditions may qualify.
Important
:  Periodontal disease is not treatable except for Class II purposes, even if secondary to an SC disability.
Reference
:  For more information on rating dental and oral conditions for compensation purposes, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, 14
.
